titleStmt.title: The noble fisher-man. Or, Robin Hood's preferment, shewing how he won a prize on the sea, and how he gave one half to his dame, and the other to the building of alm-houses. The tune is, In summer time, &c.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, and J. Wright.,

notesStmt.note: Right half sheet contains: The second part, to the same tune.
Place and date of publication from Wing (2nd ed.)
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
